definitions.definition: (with "the") Human collective existence; existence in general.
definitions.example: There will always be lovers, till the world’s end.
People are dying of starvation all over the world.

definitions.definition: A planet, especially one which is inhabited or inhabitable.
definitions.example: Our mission is to travel the galaxy and find new worlds.

definitions.definition: A very large extent of country.
(speculation) A realm, such as planet, containing one or multiple societies of beings, especially intelligent ones.
definitions.example: the world of Narnia; the Wizarding World of Harry Potter; a zombie world

definitions.definition: An individual or group perspective or social setting.
definitions.example: In the world of boxing, good diet is all-important.

definitions.definition: The part of an operating system distributed with the kernel, consisting of the shell and other programs.
A subdivision of a game, consisting of a series of stages or levels that usually share a similar environment or theme.
definitions.example: Have you reached the boss at the end of the ice world?

definitions.definition: The twenty-second trump or major arcana card of the tarot.

definitions.example: Taking a break from work seems to have done her a world of good.

definitions.definition: To consider or cause to be considered from a global perspective; to consider as a global whole, rather than making or focussing on national or other distinctions; compare globalise.
To make real; to make worldly.
